title: Highest Tariff Rate on Primary Products
description: In 2019, Egypt applied a simple mean tariff rate of 99.4% on primary products, one of the highest in the world.

title: Lowest Average Precipitation
description: Egypt recorded an average precipitation of just 18.1 mm per year in 2021, making it one of the driest countries globally.

title: High Freshwater Withdrawals
description: In 2021, Egypt's annual freshwater withdrawals were 7750% of its internal resources, indicating significant water resource challenges.

title: Full Female Persistence in Primary Education
description: In 2020, Egypt achieved a 100% persistence rate for females to grade 5 and the last grade of primary education, showcasing strong educational retention.

title: Minimal R&D Investment by Firms
description: Only 2% of firms in Egypt reported spending on R&D in 2020, reflecting low investment in research and development.

title: Low Price Level Ratio
description: In 2023, Egypt's price level ratio of PPP conversion factor to market exchange rate was 0.186, indicating a lower cost of living compared to many countries.

title: Minimal Losses from Theft and Vandalism
description: In 2020, only 0.2% of firms in Egypt reported experiencing losses due to theft and vandalism, suggesting a relatively secure business environment.

title: Significant Bilateral Aid from Germany
description: In 2022, Egypt received significant net bilateral aid flows from Germany, amounting to -$119,970,001, highlighting strong international financial support.
